intro: Reseda gilgiana, commonly known as Gilgian knotgrass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, and it often grows in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Reseda gilgiana is also known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
